meanings.definition: The act of segregating or separating a group of people based on race, ethnicity, or other factors.
meanings.sent1: The resegregation of students in schools based on their skin color is unfair.
meanings.sent2: After the civil rights movement, there was a push to end resegregation in public places.
meanings.sent3: The resegregation of jellybeans by color made for a fun game at the party.
meanings.sent4: The resegregation of the puzzle pieces by shape helped solve the mystery faster.
meanings.sent5: The resegregation of the crayons into separate boxes made it easier to find the right color.

meanings.definition: The process of reintroducing segregation after it has been eliminated.
meanings.sent1: The resegregation of water fountains based on race was a step backward in history.
meanings.sent2: The resegregation of neighborhoods led to tensions among the residents.
meanings.sent3: The resegregation of the books by genre made the library look chaotic.
meanings.sent4: The resegregation of the garden beds by plant type improved the overall organization.
meanings.sent5: The resegregation of the toys into different bins made cleaning up more efficient.
